instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Hey, board came in with 5v and no power, i checked down to cpu cover and find l7800 is burned, changed but it goes hot and <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> when pluged charger going to 1v and goes hot <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and l7800 side. Can i change <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> or its with cpu ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
PMUs can be changed.
Someone already reported compatibility between 14" and 16" boards.
